info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 08 at 11:10AM PST until December 08 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PST THIS EVENING... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT... -For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow accumulations of 6 to 10 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph that could lead to reduced visibility due to blowing snow. -For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 7 to 15 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 45 mph and likely result in reduced visibility due to blowing snow. * WHERE...Central Oregon Cascades. During the Advisory, Eastern Douglas County and NW Klamath County including, Diamond Lake Pass, highways 230, 138 (up to the intersection with highway 230), and Crater Lake NP. During the Winter Storm Watch, the same areas as well as Willamette Pass and highway 58, and highway 138 east of the intersection with highway 230. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 10 AM this morning to 10 PM PST this evening. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Friday afternoon through Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The main impact during the advisor will be from 10 AM to 4 PM PST when snowfall rates are at their highest and the winds peak. There is only a 10% chance that rates will reach one inch per hour at this time though. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.
